member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.Common.ProcessorSettings
member.summary: Information about using processor cores

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Common.ProcessorSettings.UseAllCores
member.summary: Is needed to use all cores. Compact framework can not determine the number of cores. For compact framework need use field UseOnlyThisCoresCount, to specify the number of cores.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Common.ProcessorSettings.UseOnlyThisCoresCount
member.summary: Specify the number of cores to use. You need to change the property "UseAllCores" to "false".

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Common.ProcessorSettings.MaxAdditionalAllowedThreads
member.summary: Specify the maximal number of additional threads to run code in parallel

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType
member.summary: Defines the interpreting type (CTable, NTable or Other) of customer information for AustralianPost BarCode.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.CTable
member.summary: Use CTable to interpret the customer information. Allows A..Z, a..z, 1..9, space and # sing.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.NTable
member.summary: Use NTable to interpret the customer information. Allows digits.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.Other
member.summary: Do not interpret the customer information. Allows 0, 1, 2 or 3 symbol only.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator
member.summary:
BarCodeGenerator for backend barcode images generation.
supported symbology: 1D: Codabar, Code11, Code128, Code39Standard, Code39Extended Code93Standard, Code93Extended, EAN13, EAN8, Interleaved2of5, MSI, Standard2of5, UPCA, UPCE, ISBN, GS1Code128, Postnet, Planet EAN14, SCC14, SSCC18, ITF14, SingaporePost ... 2D: Aztec, DataMatrix, PDf417, QR code ...

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.IsLicensed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether generation module is licensed.
member.value: true if generation module is licensed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.CodeText
member.summary: Data to be encoded, different types of BarCode may have different CodeText length restrictions. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.EncodeType
member.summary: BarCode's encode type (symbology). Use to get current symbology.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.CaptionAbove
member.summary: Caption Above the BarCode image. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.CaptionBelow
member.summary: Caption Below the BarCode image. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.ForeColor
member.summary: Foreground color of the barcode image, that is, Bar's color of 1D barcode, Module's color of 2D barcode. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.BackColor
member.summary: Background color of the barcode image. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.FilledBars
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether bars filled. Only for 1D barcodes. Default value is true.
member.value: true if bars filled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.BarHeight
member.summary: Height of 1D barcodes' bars in value.

exception.p: The BarHeight parameter value is less than or equal to 0.
The BarHeight can't be specified when AutoSizeMode is set to Nearest.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.XDimension
member.summary: x-dimension is the smallest width of the unit of BarCode bars or spaces. Increase this will increase the whole barcode image width.

exception.p: The XDimension parameter value is less than or equal to 0.
The XDimension can't be specified when AutoSizeMode is set to Nearest.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.WideNarrowRatio
member.summary: Wide bars to Narrow bars ratio for some 1D BarCode. Default WideNarrowRatio is 3, that is, wide bars are 3 times as wide as narrow bars. Applicable symbology: Code39Extended, Code39Standard, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Pharmacode

exception.p: The WideNarrowRatio parameter value is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the BarCode image. One value for both dimensions.

exception.p: The Resolution parameter value is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: BarCode width when property is set to AutoSizeMode.Nearest.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.BarCodeHeight

exception.p: The BarCodeHeight parameter value is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.CodeTextStyle
member.summary: Gets the that contains all configuration properties for codetext of barcode.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: Only for 1D barcodes. If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Otherwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbology if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbology if codetext is incorrect.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.AustralianPostEncodingTable
member.summary: Interpreting type for the Customer Information of AustralianPost, default to CustomerInformationInterpretingType.Other"

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. It is worked pdf417, DataMatrix, Code128 only See . If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters. Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters. For example, \013 and \\CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarCodeGenerator.PostalShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Postal barcodes.

exception.p: The PostalShortBarHeight parameter value is near 2 times smaller than BarHeight or more than 88% of the height of BarHeight.
The PostalShortBarHeight can't be specified when AutoSizeMode is set to Nearest.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.ChecksumProperties.Enable

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbology which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN, Codabar
Checksum always used: Rest symbology

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.EncodeTypes.UpcaGs1DatabarCoupon
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be encoded with UPC coupon with GS1 DataBar addition barcode specification. An example of the input string: BarCodeBuilder.Codetext = "514141100906(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000", where UPCA part is "514141100906", Databar part is "(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000". To change the caption, use barCodeBuilder.CaptionAbove.Text = "company prefix + offer code";

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes recognition.

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Default
member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be validated.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.On
member.summary: Always validate checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Off
member.summary: Do not validate checksum.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and the current exception.
member.param: The error message of the exception.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint
member.summary: Manual hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.None
member.summary: There are no heavy recognition algorithms. The fastest recognition algorithms are used there, however if image is noisy recognition will fail. Used by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.InvertImage
member.summary: Use when image is white on black background. Typically BarCode images are black on white background.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.IncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Addition algorithms are included to recognize incorrectly generated or damaged barcodes (skipped bars, stop symbol, etc). May return deniable recognition.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.ComplexBackground
member.summary: Analyzes barcode background. Useful with complex or colored backgrounds.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.MedianSmoothing
member.summary: MedianSmoothing. Works with BarcodeReader's MedianSmoothingWindowSize property. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRestoration
member.summary: Starts recognition using only the restoration algorithms from MaxQuality mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRegular
member.summary: Starts recognition using algorithms from MaxPerfomance mode. Useful to combine with other hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SpecialFormOfCells
member.summary: Starts recognition barcodes with the special form of cells. Example: dot peen Datamatrix. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SkipRotatedBarcodes
member.summary: Switches off algorithms of rotating and so increases the recognition speed. It works only for Datamatrix and linear barcodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Recognition modes. Note: only one recognition mode can be selected.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxPerformance
member.summary: Finds all the possible good and average quality barcodes. Uses only the fastest algorithms. Enabled by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxQuality
member.summary: Finds all the possible barcodes with good or bad quality. Doesn't return potential barcodes. Uses different fast and slow algorithms.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxBarCodes
member.summary: Extends MaxQuality. Finds even potential barcodes. Uses extra algorithms which may recognize incorrect barcodes, barcodes on complex background, noisy or damaged barcodes and etc. You may observe extra spurious barcodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.ManualHints
member.summary: User configures hints optionally. Allows you to adjust the balance between speed and quality manually.

member.summary: Gets a settings of using processor cores.

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout of recognition process.
member.value: The timeout.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.ChecksumValidation

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.value: The checksum validation flag.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.MedianSmoothingWindowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the median smoothing window size. Typical values are 3 or 4. Default value is 3. Recognition hint MedianSmoothing must be set. At this version a value is directly mirrored to QualitySettings.
member.value: The median smoothing window size. Typical values are 3 or 4. Default value is 3.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.StripFNC
member.summary: Strip FNC1, FNC2, FNC3 characters from codetext. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.CustomerInformationInterpretingType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Interpreting Type for the Customer Information of AustralianPost BarCode.Default is CustomerInformationInterpretingType.Other.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.Close
member.summary: Closes barcode reader.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.Abort
member.summary: Function requests termination of current recognition session from other thread. Abort is unblockable method and returns control just after calling. The method should be used when recognition process is too long.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.Read
member.summary: Reads barcode from the image.
member.returns: True if the next barcode was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.QualitySettings
member.value: QualitySettings to configure recognition quality and speed.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the recognition mode. This property allows to quickly set up and tune the processing speed and quality in a way which is the most appropriate for you needs. Default value is MaxPerformance. At this version a value is directly mirrored to QualitySettings.
member.value: The recognition mode. Default value is MaxPerformance.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.BarCodeReader.ManualHints
member.summary: Allows you to configure options of recognition accuracy and speed manually. You need to change the property "RecognitionMode" to "RecognitionMode.ManualHints". Default value is None. At this version values are directly mirrored to QualitySettings.
member.value: The manual hints. Default value is None.

member.returns: The code text of the barcode.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.MultyDecodeType
member.summary: Composite decode type.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create compound MultyDecode types that combine SingleDecodeType and MultiDecode types.
[C#] MultyDecodeType types1 = new MultyDecodeType(DecodeType.QR, DecodeType.DataMatrix); MultyDecodeType types2 = new MultyDecodeType(types1, DecodeType.Code128, DecodeType.Code39Standard); [VB.NET] Dim multyType1 As MultyDecodeType multyType1 = New MultyDecodeType(DecodeType.QR, DecodeType.DataMatrix) Dim multyType2 As MultyDecodeType multyType2 = New MultyDecodeType(multyType1, DecodeType.Code128, DecodeType.Code39Standard)

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings
P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.HighPerformance
member.value: HighPerformance recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.NormalQuality
member.value: NormalQuality recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.HighQuality
member.value: HighQuality recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.MaxBarCodes
member.value: MaxBarCodes recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowInvertImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize inverse color image as additional scan. Mode can be used when barcode is white on black background.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize inverse color image.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowIncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize barcodes which has incorrect checksumm or incorrect values. Mode can be used to recognize damaged barcodes with incorrect text.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize incorrect barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowComplexBackground
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize color barcodes on color background as additional scan. Extremely slow mode.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize color barcodes on color background.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowMedianSmoothing
member.summary: Allows engine to enable median smoothing as additional scan. Mode helps to recognize noised barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine to enable median smoothing.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.MedianSmoothingWindowSize
member.summary: Window size for median smoothing. Typical values are 3 or 4. Default value is 3. AllowMedianSmoothing must be set.
member.value: Window size for median smoothing.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowRegularImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize regular image without any restorations as main scan. Mode to recognize image as is.
member.value: Allows to recognize regular image without any restorations.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDecreasedImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize decreased image as additional scan. Size for decreasing is selected by internal engine algorithms. Mode helps to recognize barcodes which are noised and blurred but captured with high resolution.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize decreased image

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowWhiteSpotsRemoving
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize image without small white spots as additional scan. Mode helps to recognize noised image as well as median smoothing filtering.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize image without small white spots.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowOneDAdditionalScan
member.summary: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to recognize regular image with different params as additional scan. Mode helps to recongize low height 1D barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to run additional scan.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowOneDFastBarcodesDetector
member.summary: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to quickly recognize high quality barcodes which fill almost whole image. Mode helps to quickly recognize generated barcodes from Internet.
member.value: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to quickly recognize high quality barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowMicroWhiteSpotsRemoving
member.summary: Allows engine for Postal barcodes to recognize slightly noised images. Mode helps to recognize sligtly damaged Postal barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for Postal barcodes to recognize slightly noised images.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowSaltAndPaperFiltering
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize barcodes with salt and paper noise type. Mode can remove small noise with white and black dots.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize barcodes with salt and paper noise type.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDetectScanGap
member.summary: Allows engine to use gap between scans to increase recognition speed. Mode can make recognition problems with low height barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine to use gap between scans to increase recognition speed.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDatamatrixIndustrialBarcodes
member.summary: Allows engine for Datamatrix to recognize dashed industrial Datamatrix barcodes. Slow mode which helps only for dashed barcodes which consist from spots.
member.value: Allows engine for Datamatrix to recognize dashed industrial barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowQRMicroQrRestoration
member.summary: Allows engine for QR/MicroQR to recognize damaged MicroQR barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for QR/MicroQR to recognize damaged MicroQR barcodes.

member.summary: Specifies the Compact symbol for Aztec. Aztec Compact symbol permits only 1, 2, 3 or 4 layers.

member.summary: Specifies the Full-range symbol for Aztec. Aztec Full-range symbol permits from 1 to 32 layers.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.AztecSymbolMode.Rune
member.summary: Specifies the Rune symbol for Aztec. Aztec Runes are a series of small but distinct machine-readable marks. It permits only number value from 0 to 255.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder
member.summary:
BarCodeBuilder for backend barcode images generation. BarCodeBuilder is deprecated. Use instead.
supported symbology: 1D: Codabar, Code11, Code128, Code39Standard, Code39Extended Code93Standard, Code93Extended, EAN13, EAN8, Interleaved2of5, MSI, Standard2of5, UPCA, UPCE, ISBN, GS1Code128, Postnet, Planet EAN14, SCC14, SSCC18, ITF14, SingaporePost 2D: DataMatrix, PDf417, QR code

member.summary: BarCode's encode type (symbology). Use to set one of more than 64 symbologies: Code128, Code39, EAN13, EAN8, DataMatrix, Pdf417, QR, Aztec, MaxiCode, DotCode, Postnet, Planet, OneCode and other.

member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding of codetext.
member.value: The encoding for codetext.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. It is worked pdf417, DataMatrix, Code128 only See . If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters. Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters. For example, \013 and \\CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.CodeTextFont

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.CodeTextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the code text. See . See . See . See . See .
member.remarks: StringAlignment.Near means CodeText will be aligned to the left StringAlignment.Far means CodeText will be aligned to the right StringAlignment.Center means CodeText will be aligned to the center

member.summary: Adjusts the image size automatically. Recommended: true. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.ImageWidth
member.summary: BarCode image width See ., if AutoSize is true, ImageWidth will be increased accordingly Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.ImageHeight
member.summary: BarCode image's height See ., if AutoSize is true, ImageHeight will be increased accordingly Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.BorderWidth
member.summary: Border width of the BarCode image Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See . See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.xDimension
member.summary: x-dimension is the smallest width of the unit of BarCode bars or spaces. increase this will increase the whole barcode image width if AutoSize is true Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See . See BarHeight.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.yDimension
member.summary:
y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See BarHeight.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.BarHeight
member.summary: Height of 1D barcodes' bars. In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.AspectRatio
member.summary: height/width ratio (yDimension/xDimension) of 2D BarCode module. calculated based on xDimension set to 0 means not using this feature. See . See .
member.remarks: Some 2D BarCodes are square shaped, then AspectRatio is not applicable

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.Margins
member.summary: Margin area around the core BarCode image If AutoSize is false, then Width and Height is fixed, thus Margins setting will be ignored Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.SupplementSpace
member.summary: Space between main the BarCode and supplement BarCode, default Graphics Unit: millimeter See . See .

member.summary: Short bar's height of Postnet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 millimeter (0.04 inch and 0.06 inch). To set up tall bar's height, see BarHeight, which has to be between 8.28 milimeter and 9.72 milimeter (0.115 inch and 0.135 inch) see changing See . see setting tall bar's height: See BarHeight.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.PlanetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Planet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 millimeters. see changing See GraphicsUnit. see setting tall bar's height: See BarHeight.

member.summary: Background color of the barcode image See .

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbology which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN, Codabar
Checksum always used: Rest symbology

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: Only for 1D barcodes. If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Otherwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbology if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbology if codetext is incorrect.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.Columns
member.summary: 2D BarCode's columns, if setting is illegal then columns will be calculated automatically applicable SymbologyType: Pdf417, CodablockF, DatabarExpandedStacked

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.Rows
member.summary: BarCode's rows, if setting is illegal then rows will be calculated automatically. Applicable Symbology: Pdf417, DatabarExpandedStacked, CodablockF, DatabarExpandedStacked

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.SupplementData
member.summary: Supplement data following BarCodes of symbology UPCA, UPCE, EAN13, EAN8, ISBN, Interleaved2of5 or Standard2of5. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.QRErrorLevel
member.summary: Level of Reed-Solomon error correction for QR barcode. From low to high: LevelL, LevelM, LevelQ, LevelH. see QRErrorLevel.

member.summary: Version of QR Code. From Version1 to Version40 for QR code and from M1 to M4 for MicroQr. Default value is QRVersion.Auto.

member.summary: QR symbology type of BarCode's encoding mode, default mode is Auto

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.QREncodeType
member.summary: QR / MicroQR selector mode. Select ForceQR for standard QR symbols, Auto for MicroQR.

member.summary: Extended Channel Interpretation Identifiers. It is used to tell the barcode reader details about the used references for encoding the data in the symbol. Current implementation consists all well known charset encodings. Currently, it is used only for QR 2D barcode.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be attached.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.EnableChecksum.Yes
member.summary: Always use checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.EnableChecksum.No
member.summary: Do not use checksum.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.MarginsF
member.summary: Specifies the margins of a barcode image.

remarks.p: This class is used to manipulate margins in barcode image.
Note : The actual amount of the margins are determined by the specified mesure unit of the barcode image.
Left, Right, Top, and Bottom are properties that define the margins.
Equals determines if another object is equal to a MarginsF object.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Auto
member.summary: Encode codetext as is non-Unicode charset. If there is any Unicode character, the codetext will be encoded with value which is set in CodeTextEncoding.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Bytes
member.summary: Encode codetext as plain bytes. If it detects any Unicode character, the character will be encoded as two bytes, lower byte first.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Utf8BOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Utf16BEBOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character. It can be problems with some barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.ECIEncoding
member.summary: Encode codetext with value set in the ECIEncoding property. It can be problems with some old (pre 2006) barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.ExtendedCodetext

summary.para: Extended Channel mode which supports FNC1 first position, FNC1 second position and multi ECI modes.
It is better to use QrExtCodetextBuilder for extended codetext generation.
Use Display2DText property to set visible text to removing managing characters.
Encoding Principles:
All symbols "\" must be doubled "\\" in the codetext.
FNC1 in first position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1>"
FNC1 in second position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1(value)>". The value must be single symbols (a-z, A-Z) or digits from 0 to 99.
Group Separator for FNC1 modes is set as 0x1D character '\\u001D'
If you need to insert "<FNC1>" string into barcode write it as "<\FNC1>"
ECI identifiers are set as single slash and six digits identifier "\000026" - UTF8 ECI identifier
TO disable current ECI mode and convert to default JIS8 mode zero mode ECI indetifier is set. "\000000"
All unicode characters after ECI identifier are automatically encoded into correct character codeset.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Web.UI.BarCodeWebControl.yDimension
member.summary:
y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter see . see .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Web.UI.BarCodeWebControl.BarHeight
member.summary: height of 1D barcodes' bars. In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter see .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Web.UI.BarCodeWebControl.ForeColor
member.summary: Foreground color of the barcode image, that is, Bar's color of 1D barcode, Module's color of 2D barcode see .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Web.UI.BarCodeWebControl.BackColor
member.summary: Background color of the barcode image see .

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Web.UI.BarCodeWebControl.AspectRatio
member.summary: 2D BarCode's module's height/width ratio (yDimension/xDimension). calculated based on xDimension set to 0 means not using this feature. see . see .
member.remarks: Some 2D BarCodes are square shaped, then AspectRatio is not appliable

member.summary: BarCode Windows Control, goto your toolbox panel and add BarCode.dll, and you will see BarCodeControl appears. member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. see If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters. Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters, 0 through 31. For example, \013 and \CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeGeneratorControl.AutoSizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode by which the barcode automatically resizes. Default value is AutoSizeMode.None.

member.summary: Gets the that contains all configuration properties for codetext of barcode.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeGeneratorControl.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Otherwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Only for 1D barcodes. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbology if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbology if codetext is incorrect.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeGeneratorControl.AustralianPostEncodingTable
member.summary: Interpreting type for the Customer Information of AustralianPost, default to CustomerInformationInterpretingType.Other"

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeGeneratorControl.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. It is worked pdf417, DataMatrix, Code128 only See . If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters. Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters. For example, \013 and \\CR stands for CR.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.PostnetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Postnet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 milimeter (0.04 inch and 0.06 inch). To set up tall bar's height, see BarHeight, which has to be between 8.28 milimeter and 9.72 milimeter (0.115 inch and 0.135 inch)

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.PrinterName
member.summary: Choose printer, if not specified, Print() method will choose the first available printer

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.QREncodeMode
member.summary: QR symbology type of BarCode's encoding mode, default mode is Auto

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.QRErrorLevel
member.summary: Level of Reed-Solomon error correction for QR barcode. From low to high: LevelL, LevelM, LevelQ, LevelH

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the image

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.RotationAngleF
member.summary: BarCode image's rotation angle, measured in degree, e.g. RotationAngleF = 0 or RotationAngleF = 360 means no rotation. If RotationAngleF NOT equal to 90, 180, 270 or 0, it may increase the difficulty for the scanner to read the image, please set quality mode to anti-alias

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Rows
member.summary: 2D BarCode's rows, if setting is illegal then rows will be calculated automatically. appliable Symbology: Pdf417

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.SupplementData
member.summary: Supplement data following BarCodes of symbology UPCA, UPCE, EAN13, EAN8, BooklandEAN, Interleaved2of5 or Standard2of5

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.SupplementSpace
member.summary: Space between main the BarCode and supplement BarCode, default Graphics Unit: millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.WideNarrowRatio
member.summary: Wide bars to Narrow bars ratio for some 1D BarCode. Appliable symbology: Code39Extended, Code39Standard, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.xDimension
member.summary: x-dimension, smallest width unit of BarCode's bars or spaces

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.yDimension
member.summary: y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.BarCode.WPF contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes generation and drawing.
